body.name: Gunsmoke in Silver City: A Historical Western Adventure Novel
body.description: In the blistering Arizona sun, Rowdy Killjoy escapes his parents' pox-ridden demise, setting a fiery path to Silver City with his mule. Haunted by memories of his family, Rowdy arrives in town seeking solace but is instead thrust into chaos when a bank heist unfolds. His quick draw turns the tide, landing him the role of deputy sheriff, but the Taylor brothers' thirst for revenge escalates the danger...Can Rowdy outgun the merciless outlaws and protect the town he's come to call home?As the outlaws regroup, Rowdy's newfound badge becomes a target. Silver City transforms into a battleground, echoing with gunfire and the thundering hooves of pursuit. When the ruthless Taylor brothers snatch the woman Rowdy has come to care for, the chase propels him south into Mexico's treacherous terrain. A relentless pursuit ensues, forcing Rowdy to confront not only the gang but the shadows of his past.Will he emerge unscathed from the dangerous mission?Rowdy's journey becomes a high-stakes gambit, where survival demands lightning-quick reflexes and courage. Rowdy's journey for redemption soon becomes a breathless race against time, and the destiny of Silver City teeters on the edge. Will Rowdy take down the dangerous gang, or will the unforgiving frontier swallow him whole?"Gunsmoke in Silver City" is a historical adventure novel of approximately 55,000 words. No cliffhangers, only pure unadulterated action. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another sensational series of unending western adventures that will appease anyone's expectations l
reviews.reviewText: Definitely another five star extravaganza that is awesome from beginning to end! Mr. McConley goes above and beyond in this compelling series of unending realistically motivated western excitement that anyone will enjoy following!Some of the most entertaining western storylines I have had the opportunity to read, and I have read a few, thus far! No slowdowns throughout this fast moving series of unending gun fighting at its very best! Great selection of characters that will appease anyone's desired expectations cover to cover! Just be ready to read the entire book, as the Author will impress you immediately, and the story only gets better with each new endeavor!Most certainly recommend this compelling series of unending western adventures to everyone, but I definitely assure you western adventures fanatics will enjoy riding along with the good guys, as they bring justice to those responsible for their misdeeds! Try it! You'll love it!!!😃

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Story!!! Well Written
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoy your books and story lines.. They are well written and have some suspense in them along with being a western story.. Only problem I had was with the extended story the name of Molly was changed to Bonnie. Took me a little to figure that out.keep up the great story lines .Will look for more of your booksA fan In IowaKaren

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Old West Adventure
reviews.reviewText: A western adventure as big as the New Mexico sky. I enjoyed this book very much. The story starts with tragedy and ramps up as it goes. This was a great read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What’s in a name?
reviews.reviewText: Really well written. Great character development. The style of writing was good.I was rather angry that Preacher was killed.When I read the Extended Epilogue I was disappointed that the names did not flow from the book to the epilogue, Molly/Bonnie.That should have been an easy catch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Western Story
reviews.reviewText: Young man who knew how to handle a gun gets tangled up with a gang of gunslingers after stopping a bank robbery. Does he save the damsels in distress and save the day? Read to see.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a story that I thoroughly enjoyed. The back and forth between Rowdy the sheriff and Preacher his half-breed deputy is fantastic. There was a lot of shooting and killing but not for anyone that didn't deserve it. Any one that likes Westerns should read this story. A+

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked the characters and the action. There was lots of action and surprises. It was good to see the kid growing into a man.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A 5-star for sure.
reviews.reviewText: Another good book from McConley. Amongst all the flying bullets there was some fun dialog between Rowdy and his scout. Easy and enjoyable read

Rowdy Killjoy at eighteen years of age has just buried his parents and heads to Silver City. He enters the bank and is there just before a robbery attempt. His quick draw ends with the four bank robbers dead, and he is offered the job of deputy sheriff. Lots of adventures for this young man as he takes on his responsibilities.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed reading this story and loved the camaraderie between The Kid Sherriff and his deputy. They certainly gave more than a few bandits a run for their money.A couple of complaints though as I never did find out if Rowdy's dad was indeed a Texas Ranger or a gun slinger as was implied by one of the gang members.Unfortunately in the extended epilogue Molly's name changed to Bonnie so someone needs to reedit that one, not up to the usual standard.

reviews.reviewTitle: I recommend this book to anyone.
reviews.reviewText: What I liked beside the story line was that the editing and proofreading was kept at a bare minimum. I hate it when you have to read between the lines to get the meaning because of poor proofreading. Keep them coming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 20, 2024
